paper_metadata.title: Analysis of Ghana's LEAP Conditional Cash Transfer Program Effects on Labor

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) which is a cash transfer programme

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Specifically, the objectives of this paper are to find out whether: -The conditional cash transfer scheme has in general increased the probability of households to work; -The hours worked on farm (agriculture) and off-farm (non-farm enterprises) have increased with the CCT scheme; -Working hours for paid employment (employment opportunities) in the households have increased with the LEAP programme

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Livelihood Empowerment Against Poverty (LEAP) which is a cash transfer programme
evidence_citations.country_citation: Over the past decade Ghana has made impressive progress in stimulating economic growth, reducing poverty, and improving governance
